The Hunter and the Hunted. Hide and Seek is one of the most basic games of the childhood of any culture. This game is the best at achieving the thrill of the hunt between predator and prey. As a killer, you must carefully manage your time as you plan your next strike. As a survivor, you must buy as much time for your team as possible while also figuring out the best time to stand still next to the objective for 80 seconds. Both sides can be fun. Survivor is hard to start, easy to master. While killer is easy to start, and VERY hard to master. Because of the 4v1 nature of the game the killer must minimize mistakes while constantly prioritizing which area of the map to search next. As a survivor, teamwork is key. IMO this game is much more fun without voice communication. Using the gestures in game to mime certain communication is way more realistic to me in a scenario where you must stay quiet. It would be interesting if they added an item or perk that allowed voip in game. (Walkie Talkie from Stranger Things?) This would be cool because the survivors could communicate the killer's location across any distance, but if they aren't careful they might give away someone's location. I digress, this is a great game very worth $20. The in-game store can feel like a rip-off, but they have sales every so often. 9/10
It's a addicting game,the problem is the meta are only 3 killers and swf,op perks and items.It's sad to see this game fall apart
A good game to play with mates, not sure if I would recommend to play it by yourself as it gets a bit boring unless you like playing killer which is played solo.

Unfortunately the game has been balanced around group survivors, which have a huge advantage in communication (knowing where the killer is) and teamplay (interfering with the killer while they try to hook someone). That leaves those of us that like to survive solo with a bunch of perks that are useless, because they rely on others to work. Worse, if you like playing killer, you also have to deal with those toxic groups. Prepare to be teabagged all over as the supposed *killer* in this game. Yea, it's like that.

They could just give a small buff to solo survivors in repair, or walking, or some random category to encourage that type of gameplay. That would make it more fun for killers too, to encounter less SWF groups. But it's been years now, so let's not hold out hope.

The game was originally a good game.  The developers however, have completely lost touch with the survivor side of the game.  They have touched survivor game play since the inception of the game and have only added on meta perk, Circle of Healing, to the survivor-side of the game in the last 4 years. 

If you play this game, then play the Killer side.  Killers get new gameplay changes every killer release, they get new usable perks every release. 

The developers continue to leave horrible game-design flaws in the game since the inceptions, such as allowing killers to stand in front of you after you are hooked and completely prevent you from playing the game.  The developer don't understand that game-health needs to be looked at in the game, and let serious game design flaws to linger in the game without ever addressing them.  

Think of DBD like a hotel and think of the developers as the owner.  They own built all these awesome rooms, then forgot about those rooms and built newer rooms around the now decaying and rat infested original rooms.
